addressleaf.section:
1591 14 Aprill To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. although no present
occasion doth presse me to troble yo
w
, for that
the affaires of this state doe minister litle mater,
yet I thought it not superfluous, to give yo
r
L.
so muche notice, that heere is nothing in action,
that is greatly materiall. Onely as this day
the
Count of Overstein
, and
S
r
Francis Vere
are in
hand to surprise
e towne of
Stralen
in
Guelder-
land
, whiche is held by a garrison of
e Enemie
but being a land towne, and weakely fortified,
they make good account to speede of their purpose.
It hath neere adjoining unto it
Venlo,
Wachten-
donke
, and
Gelre,
w
ch
are situat about it in
forme
maner
of a triangle. Of
e Enemies
attemptes heere is nothing certaine. It is suppo-
sed that
e want of forrage, and
e backwardnes
of
e springe in these contreis, hath staied his
designe for assieging
Breda:
whiche is also
some occasion, that
e forces of these contreis,
w
ch
are
in good readines
otherwise
very forward
can not yet
come abroade to keepe
e feelde. The
substitute of
Commissary Wiat
hath joined of late
w
t
e states Commissary, in
e quarters of
Guel-
ders
, and both together have passed a muster,
and signed their bookes, w
t
allowance of
e 15
dead paies. The
Councel of state
being certified
of it, is highly offended w
t
their officer, and
hath written
their
letters to
e states of Guelders
to disavowe his proceeding. For they are bent
for that
mater
point
not to change their wonted course
though
and yet for my self,
in conference w
t
them I lette them plainely
understand, that they doe but strive against the
streame, to refuse her Ma
tie
in a
cause of open
mater of so muche
equitie, as when in
e end they shall come to
fol.129v
Belgia: 1591: Ap
r
To my L. Treasurer A
p
15 1591.
account, they will be forced to acknowledge.
whiche I thought somwhat requisit to advertise
yo
r
L.
and so I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. A
p
14 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
